definition: to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in

sentences.english: I am fascinated to see all the varied approaches to making with clay.
sentences.chinese: 我陶醉于陶艺家们运用各种方法进行陶泥创作。

sentences.english: And two people can indulge in imperviousness as well as in anything else.
sentences.chinese: 冷淡也像其他感情一样，也能使两个人陶醉。

sentences.english: Contestants mesmerised by their own singing.
sentences.chinese: 参赛者陶醉在自己的歌声中。

sentences.english: Leads people to not forget that fascinating dream.
sentences.chinese: 总让人不能忘怀那令人陶醉的梦。

sentences.english: We were charmed with the blue hills and green streams here.
sentences.chinese: 我们陶醉在这里的绿水青山之中。

sentences.english: The travelers were beguiled by the beauty of the landscapes.
sentences.chinese: 游客们被景色的美丽所陶醉。

sentences.english: This was the most intoxicant and unforgettable scene in the dawn of European history.
sentences.chinese: 这曾是欧洲历史的黎明中最令人陶醉而难忘的一幕。

sentences.english: She could hear nothing but the waves and the seagulls flying up above in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 耳边的海浪声和海鸥掠过天空的声音让她陶醉。

sentences.english: Of course, self-satisfaction is tantamount enabling me to be more confidence.
sentences.chinese: 当然，自我陶醉也无形中使到陈董越来越来有信心。

sentences.english: I proudly pointed at the pig's feet braised in soy sauce, revelling in my own achievement.
sentences.chinese: 我指着红烧猪蹄，得意洋洋，自我陶醉。

sentences.english: This typical local dish which has a special strong taste intoxicates people.
sentences.chinese: 这个风味菜有一种强烈的特殊口味，令人陶醉。

sentences.english: A gentle breeze whistles through the pine forest and bamboo groves.
sentences.chinese: 清风徐来，松涛竹籁，美景令人陶醉。

sentences.english: The distillation would intoxicate me also, but I shall not let it.
sentences.chinese: 其精华也会使我陶醉，但我不容许这样。

sentences.english: Has the feeling in a happy study classroom which one kind easely is infatuated with.
sentences.chinese: 在一个愉快学习的课堂上有一种令人悠然陶醉的感觉。

sentences.english: It is quite a heady wine its full and supple tastes, which goes well with red meat and cheeses.
sentences.chinese: 此酒柔和贺润，令人陶醉，可搭配红肉和各类奶酪。

definition: lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth/also written 如癡如醉|如痴如醉[ru2 chi1 ru2 zui4]
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to be fascinated/to be rapt/to long for/to dream of
